title: Teresa Giudice shares weekend fun with daughters after court lets husband Joe go to Italy
text:
Teresa Giudice is staying focused on family mid tough times.

The Real Housewives of New Jersey star, 47, had a packed autumn weekend with her daughters showcasing their activities on her Instagram.

It comes after her husband Joe Giudice, 47, was granted release from ICE custody so he can return to Italy and work while his immigration situation makes its way through the courts.

Fall fun: Real Housewives of New Jersey star Teresa Giudice, 47, had a packed autumn weekend with her daughters amid news her husband Joe Giudice was granted a release from ICE custody. She posed with oldest daughter Gia, 18, at a football game at Rutgers University in the family's native New Jersey Saturday

Teresa and Joe have four daughters together - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10.

The reality star visited her eldest daughter Gia for a football game at Rutgers University on Saturday.

She wore a red shirt that read 'Rutgers Mom' as the school suffered a 48-7 defeat at the hands of visiting Maryland.

She also shared video as she attended daughter Gabriella's soccer match Saturday and celebrated her birthday Sunday, as well as relaxing in Croton-on-Hudson, New York with daughter Audriana.

On Saturday, she spent time with her friend Elvira Grau at Space 54, a New York City-based venue for events.

Last week, a federal court in New Jersey granted Joe's request to go to Italy as his attorney James Leonard told the appeals court that Joe looked to 'begin working' in Italy and 'contributing financially' to his family, according to TMZ.

Fun time: Teresa posed with Audriana, 10, in Croton-on-Hudson, New York

Unwinding: The RHONJ mainstay and her youngest daughter were dressed for cold weather on the autumn evening

Luxe life: Teresa posed with pals at the NYC venue Space 54 on Saturday

Joe, who came to the US as a child but never obtained citizenship, has been slated for deportation in the wake of his 2014 conviction on mail, wire and bankruptcy fraud charges.

As result, federal officials ordered his deportation following his sentence, due to his admission to 'a crime of moral turpitude' or 'aggravated felony.'

Joe concluded his a 41-month prison sentence at Fort Dix, New Jersey's Federal Correctional Institution this past March, and has been held in ICE custody at Pennsylvania's Clinton County Correctional Center pending his appeal to remain close to his family in the states.

'Not being able to see his family, and knowing that he won’t be able to be back home with them, has really broken him,' an insider told People.

Joe is expected to be transported to Italy in a few weeks, a source told E! News Thursday, and has a place to stay and a gig waiting for him there.

His case returns to court in November.

And many more: The family celebrated Gabriella's 15th birthday on Sunday

Appetizing: Teresa, who has released cookbooks in the past, showed off a dinner she prepared
description: Teresa, who shares four daughters with Joe - Gia, 18, Gabriella, 15, Milania, 14, and Audriana, 10 - took to Instagram to showcase a series of outings she had on the busy weekend.
